intro: Gisekia linearifolia, commonly known as the slender-leaf gisekia, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom during the rainy season. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
